definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home

sentences.english: In a quiet funeral, Shmi was buried at the Lars homestead.
sentences.chinese: 在一場平靜的葬禮中，施密被安葬在拉爾斯家宅。

sentences.english: Something said could shed light on an issue to do with your home or finances.
sentences.chinese: 所說的事情能闡明與您家宅或財務有關的結果。

sentences.english: There are many old homesteads in New England .
sentences.chinese: 在新英格蘭有許多古老的家宅。

sentences.english: There are many old homesteads in New England.
sentences.chinese: 在新英格蘭有很多古老的家宅。

sentences.english: Nina sends backup to the Bauer home.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他派了一隊支援去鮑爾的家宅。

definition: residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home
lit. inviting wealth/We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
to add a son to the family
